programName: Structural Engineering with a Specialization in Structural Health Monitoring/Non-Destructive Evaluation (B.S.)
fullProgramDescription: The Structural Engineering with a Specialization in Structural Health Monitoring/Non-Destructive Evaluation program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of structural engineering principles and practices, with a focus on the application of structural health monitoring and non-destructive evaluation techniques. The program includes coursework in mathematics, physics, materials science, and structural analysis, as well as specialized courses in structural health monitoring and non-destructive evaluation.
shortProgramDescription: The Structural Engineering with a Specialization in Structural Health Monitoring/Non-Destructive Evaluation B.S. program provides students with a solid foundation in structural engineering and specialized knowledge in structural health monitoring and non-destructive evaluation.
classHighlights: The program includes foundational coursework in mathematics and physics, including Calculus (MATH20A-B-C-D), Physics (PHYS2A-B-C), and Differential Equations (MATH20D, MATH140A-B).
Students take core courses in structural engineering, including Structural Analysis (SE101A-B), Mechanics of Materials (SE104), and Structural Design (SE151A-B).

Specialized coursework in structural health monitoring and non-destructive evaluation includes Sensors and Sensing Systems (SE125), Structural Health Monitoring (SE165), and Non-Destructive Evaluation (SE166).
Students also complete additional coursework in materials science, including Materials Science and Engineering (NANO15 or MAE3), and engineering electives.
The program includes laboratory coursework, including Structural Engineering Laboratory (SE110A-B) and Experimental Methods in Structural Engineering (SE162).
learningOutcomes: Apply mathematical and scientific principles to solve structural engineering problems
Understand the principles of structural health monitoring and non-destructive evaluation
Apply sensors and sensing systems to structural health monitoring
Evaluate the effectiveness of non-destructive evaluation techniques
additionalInformation: The program is designed to be completed in four years. Students are advised to consult with the department advisor to ensure they are meeting the program requirements.
